title: SES confirms merger talks with Intelsat
summary: SES confirmed March 29 it is in talks with Intelsat about potentially merging the two satellite operators.

title: NASA Receives Top Honor of Best Place to Work in Federal Government
summary: NASA is taking home the honor of the Best Place to Work in the Federal Government among large agencies for 11 years in a row, as ranked by the Partnership for Public Service.

title: Space infrastructure company Redwire trims quarterly losses, builds order backlog
summary: Space infrastructure company Redwire reported fourth-quarter results on Wednesday, saying it further trimmed its losses and built its order backlog.

title: Israel launches Ofek spy satellite
summary: Israel launched the latest in a series of Ofek reconnaissance satellites March 28 on the country’s Shavit rocket.

title: Impact Observatory raises $5.9 million to apply AI to satellite imagery
summary: Impact Observatory, a company that pairs satellite imagery with artificial intelligence for mapping and monitoring, raised $5.9 million in seed funding.

title: H3 failure could delay Japanese science missions
summary: The failure of Japan’s H3 rocket on its inaugural flight in March could delay several science missions, including two scheduled to launch on another rocket.

title: Lockheed Martin subsidiary to offer commercial lunar communications and navigation services
summary: Lockheed Martin is establishing a new company that will offer communications and navigation services for what it foresees to be a growing number of government and commercial lunar missions.

title: Ovzon gets deadline extension for debut satellite
summary: Mobile satcom services provider Ovzon said March 28 it has secured a deadline extension enabling it to keep priority spectrum rights for its first broadband satellite, as long as it launches early enough in a July-September window SpaceX has set for the mission.

title: U.S. Space Force ramps up cybersecurity spending
summary: The head of the U.S. Space Force told lawmakers March 28 that the service is investing heavily in cybersecurity for satellite ground systems in response to increasing threats.

title: Air Force Secretary: ‘Haven’t made a decision on U.S. Space Command’
summary: The Department of the Air Force has received no official communication from the White House regarding the relocation of U.S. Space Command's headquarters, Secretary Frank Kendall told lawmakers.
